fields.headline: Smoking ban dates announced
fields.bodyText: The smoking ban for all enclosed public places and workplaces will begin in Wales from April and England from July, the health secretary, Patricia Hewitt, announced yesterday. "Thousands of lives will be saved and the health of thousands more protected," she said. Businesses which do not enforce the ban face fines of up to £2,500. Smoking was banned in nearly all enclosed public places in Scotland earlier this year. Deborah Arnott, director of the anti-smoking charity ASH, added: "This law is good for health. The only losers are the tobacco companies who have fought this incredibly important measure." Brendan Barber, general secretary of the TUC, said: "Pubs, bars and restaurants will become healthier places to work overnight."
